ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement.OFTimeTriggerManagement.OFTimeTriggerImplementation

Class TriggFrequently

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement.OFTimeTriggerManagement.OFTimeTriggerImplementation.TriggFrequently
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OFTimeTriggerInterface

    public class TriggFrequently
extends java.lang.Object
implements OFTimeTriggerInterface
    This class create a new Quartz Trigger with particular parameter. The ontology must contain an individual which has those properties: 
     
        implementsOFTimeTriggerName "ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement.
 		OFTimeTriggerManagement.OFTimeTriggerImplementation.TriggFrequently"^^string
  hasTypeTriggerDefinition "
  in:ontologyFramework.OFEventManagement.OFEventParameter.
			?frequency 10.AsInteger
			?couter ^.AsInteger
			?priority 6.AsInteger
			!r triggFrequentlyInSeconds( ?frequency ?priority ?couter)"^^strign
    So the method isCorrectInput(List) returns true only if: inputs.get(0).getParameter() instanceof Integer, inputs.get(1).getParameter() instanceof Integer and (inputs.get(2).getParameter() == null) || (inputs.get(2).getParameter() instanceof Integer) are true. While the method getTrigger(List, OFBuildedListInvoker) returns a quartz trigger with the specified parameter. If count number is equal to null than, the trigger has repeatForever() property. if counter is 0 than the trigger is "fired now" only once
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca

    • Method Detail

      • isCorrectInput

        public boolean isCorrectInput(java.util.List<EventComputedData> inputs)
        Description copied from interface: OFTimeTriggerInterface
        sviluppated with safety pourposes it is called to check if the type of parameter in inputs are correct. If this return false the event result of OFTimeTriggerInterface.getTrigger(List, OFBuildedListInvoker) will be setted to null.
        Specified by:
        isCorrectInput in interface OFTimeTriggerInterface
        Parameters:
        inputs - ordered in accord with the ontological definition of the events trhougth the object property "hasTypeTimeTriggereDefinition
        Returns:
        true if the inputs are corrects. If return else, event computation dennied.
